Plane shapes

1. Properties of shapes


ID is: 1841 Seed is: 8949

Types of quadrilaterals

Given the following diagram:

Select the most specific name for the figure from choices in the list below.

Answer: The shape is a .
STEP: Select the most specific name for the shape shown
[1 point 0 / 1 points left]

This polygon has four sides, so it is a quadrilateral. In fact, we were given two pairs of parallel sides and adjacent sides equal.

A rhombus is a quadrilateral with two pairs of opposite sides parallel and adjacent sides equal.

So, this quadrilateral is a rhombus.

NOTE: The shape is also a parallelogram and a quadrilateral. This question, however, asked for the most specific name for the shape!

ID is: 1841 Seed is: 3942

Types of quadrilaterals

Given the following diagram:

Select the most specific name for the figure from choices in the list below.

Answer: The shape is a .
STEP: Select the most specific name for the shape shown
[1 point 0 / 1 points left]

This polygon has four sides, so it is a quadrilateral. In fact, we were given two pairs of parallel sides, adjacent sides equal and corner angles that are 9090.

A square is a quadrilateral with two pairs of opposite sides parallel, adjacent sides equal and all corners 9090.

So, this quadrilateral is a square.

NOTE: The shape is also a rectangle, rhombus, parallelogram and a quadrilateral. This question, however, asked for the most specific name for the shape!

2. The theorem of Pythagoras


ID is: 4167 Seed is: 7482

Apply Pythagoras

Determine the value of xx.

INSTRUCTION: Round your answer to two decimal places.
Answer: x=x= mm
one-of
type(numeric.abserror(0.01))
2 attempts remaining
HINT: <no title>
[0 points 3 / 3 points left]

The theorem of Pythagoras gives a relationship between the three sides in a triangle. What is the relationship?

STEP: Use the theorem of Pythagoras to find xx
[3 points 0 / 3 points left]

The theorem of Pythagoras tells us that:

In a right-angled triangle, the sum of the squares of the two short sides is equal to the square of the hypotenuse.

The hypotenuse is the side opposite the right angle.

AC2=AB2+BC2(Pythagoras)162=122+x2256=144+x2256144=144+x2144112=x2x2=112AC2=AB2+BC2(Pythagoras)162=122+x2256=144+x2256144=144+x2144112=x2x2=112

The equation x2=112x2=112 has two solutions: 112112 or 112112. However, xx is always positive because it is a length. So, we discard the negative solution. We must use our calculator to determine the positive square root of 112112.

x=112x=10.58300...x=10.58x=112x=10.58300...x=10.58

Therefore xx is 10.58 mm10.58 mm.

NOTE: Pythagoras was a man who lived in Greece 2500 years ago. Whenever we use his theorem, we have to write Pythagoras as our reason. It is our way of thanking him for proving this very important fact about triangles.

Word problems involving the theorem of Pythagoras

A ladder is 13 metres13 metres long. The bottom of the ladder is placed on the ground 5 metres5 metres away from a wall. The ladder is leaned against the wall and it just touches the top. How high is the wall?

Answer: The wall is metresmetres high.
numeric
2 attempts remaining
HINT: <no title>
[0 points 3 / 3 points left]

Start by drawing a diagram to represent the situation. Then try to assign each value of the example to a side of a right-angled triangle. In this case the hypotenuse of the triangle is the ladder.

STEP: Draw a diagram and label everything you know
[1 point 2 / 3 points left]

The ladder is 13 metres13 metres long. The distance from the wall to the base of the ladder is 5 metres5 metres.

The ladder is the hypotenuse of a right-angled triangle. Let the height of the wall be xx.

STEP: Use the theorem of Pythagoras to calculate the height of the wall
[2 points 0 / 3 points left]
(13)2=(5)2+x2(Pythagoras)169=25+x216925=25+x225144=x2x2=144x=144x=12x=12(13)2=(5)2+x2(Pythagoras)169=25+x216925=25+x225144=x2x2=144x=144x=12x=12
NOTE: When dealing with lengths, the answer cannot be negative. So we must throw away the negative answer.

The height of the wall is 12 metres12 metres.

ID is: 4259 Seed is: 5019

Longest straight line

A rectangular piece of paper is 22 cm22 cm long and 16 cm16 cm wide.

What is the length of the longest straight line that can be drawn across this piece of paper?

INSTRUCTION: Round your answer to two decimal places.
Answer: Longest line = cmcm
one-of
type(numeric.abserror(0.01))
2 attempts remaining
HINT: <no title>
[0 points 4 / 4 points left]

There is always one way to draw the longest line across a rectangle. Use your ruler and a piece of paper to figure out what this is.

STEP: Figure out how to draw the longest line
[2 points 2 / 4 points left]

At first, you might think that the length of the paper is the longest straight line.

However, you will notice that as you move the ruler up the opposite side of the page, the line gets longer.

If we keep moving the endpoint of the line up, the line gets longer and longer until we get to the diagonal. If we keep going on, the line gets shorter again. So, the diagonal is the longest possible straight line.

STEP: Calculate the length of the diagonal
[2 points 0 / 4 points left]

The diagonal is the hypotenuse of a right-angled triangle, so we can use the theorem of Pythagoras. Let the length of the diagonal be xx.

x2=(22)2+(16)2(Pythagoras)x2=740x=740x=27.20294...27.20 cmx2=(22)2+(16)2(Pythagoras)x2=740x=740x=27.20294...27.20 cm

Therefore, the length of the longest straight line that can be drawn across this piece of paper is 27.20 cm27.20 cm.

NOTE: You must write "Pythagoras" as your reason to explain your thinking.

ID is: 1832 Seed is: 675

Calculate the length of the hypotenuse

The diagram below shows a right-angled triangle.

Use the theorem of Pythagoras to calculate the length of the hypotenuse.

Answer: The length of the hypotenuse is unitsunits.
numeric
2 attempts remaining
HINT: <no title>
[0 points 3 / 3 points left]

The theorem of Pythagoras states:

a2+b2=c2a2+b2=c2
.

In this formula, cc represents the hypotenuse. You need to substitute the other sides of the triangle into the formula for aa and bb. Then solve for cc.

STEP: Identify the hypotenuse and substitute into the theorem of Pythagoras
[1 point 2 / 3 points left]

We have a right-angled triangle, and we know two of the side lengths. We need to find the length of the third side. We can use the theorem of Pythagoras to solve this question because it connects all three sides of any right-angled triangle. The theorem states:

a2+b2=c2a2+b2=c2

where:

  • cc is the hypotenuse of the triangle.
  • aa and bb are the other two sides of the triangle.

Whenever we use the theorem of Pythagoras, we must identify the hypotenuse of the triangle. The hypotenuse is always the side opposite from the right angle.

In this question, we need to find the hypotenuse, cc. We can substitute the other two sides in for aa and bb.

a2+b2=c2(Pythagoras)(16)2+(12)2=c2a2+b2=c2(Pythagoras)(16)2+(12)2=c2
NOTE: It does not matter which number we substitute in for aa and which for bb. The side that matters is the hypotenuse. So we could substitute the lengths in the other way, and we will still get the correct answer:
a2+b2=c2(12)2+(16)2=c2a2+b2=c2(12)2+(16)2=c2
STEP: Solve for cc
[1 point 1 / 3 points left]

Now we can solve the equation for the value of cc. First evaluate the left side of the equation.

(16)2+(12)2=c2256+144=c2400=c2(16)2+(12)2=c2256+144=c2400=c2

Now we must take the square root of both sides of the equation to remove the exponent on cc. When we do this, we must remember to bring in a symbol. This is because if 400=c2400=c2, there are two numbers which can make 400400 when we square them: one positive number and one negative number.

400=c2400=c20=c400=c2400=c20=c

This means:

c=20orc=20c=20orc=20
STEP: Find the final answer
[1 point 0 / 3 points left]

We get two different answers because when you square either 2020 or 2020 you get 400400. But remember that we are calculating a length. And so the answer cannot be negative (a length must be positive). That means we must throw away the negative answer, leaving c=20c=20.

TIP: The hypotenuse is always the longest side of a right-angled triangle. Check your answer to make sure it is larger than the other two sides of the triangle.

The length of the hypotenuse is 2020 units.

Submit your answer as:

ID is: 4213 Seed is: 5118

Calculating diagonals

The side of a square is 12 m12 m long.

What is the length of the diagonal of the square? Give a reason for your answer.

INSTRUCTION: Round your answer to two decimal places.
Answer: Diagonal == mm
one-of
type(numeric.abserror(0.01))
2 attempts remaining
HINT: <no title>
[0 points 4 / 4 points left]

Draw a diagram to represent the scenario. Remember, a diagonal goes from one corner to the opposite corner, cutting the quadrilateral into two triangles.

STEP: Draw a diagram
[2 points 2 / 4 points left]

The diagonal goes from one corner of the square to the other corner. Since this is a square, we also know that the corner angles are all equal to 9090.

Since this is a square we know that all the sides will be equal to 12 m12 m.

We have now formed two right-angled triangles. So, we can use the theorem of Pythagoras to calculate the length of the diagonal.

STEP: Apply the theorem of Pythagoras
[2 points 0 / 4 points left]

STEP: Find the name of the missing side
[1 point 2 / 3 points left]

The first part of this question asks us to name the side of the triangle labelled xx. The side is named according to its endpoints, which are AA and BB. So we can refer to the side as either ABAB or BABA.

STEP: Use the theorem of Pythagoras to calculate the value of xx
[2 points 0 / 3 points left]

We can answer this question using the theorem of Pythagoras because the triangle is a right-angled triangle. To use the theorem of Pythagoras we must identify which side of the triangle is the hypotenuse. The hypotenuse is the side of the triangle across from the right angle.

In this case we know the hypotenuse is 3030, and we are looking for one of the other sides of the triangle. So,

(30)2=x2+(24)2(Pythagoras)900=x2+576900576=x2324=x2324=x18=x(30)2=x2+(24)2(Pythagoras)900=x2+576900576=x2324=x2324=x18=x
NOTE: We can see that xx can be either 324324 or +324+324. But since the answer is a length, it cannot be a negative number. So we throw out the negative answer and keep the positive one.

The correct answers are:

  1. The side labelled xx is AB.
  2. x=x= 18 units18 units.

Working backwards from the diagonal

The diagonal of a square is 4 cm4 cm.

What is the length of each side of the square? Give a reason for your answer.

INSTRUCTION: Round your answer to two decimal places.
Answer: Each side == cmcm
one-of
type(numeric.abserror(0.01))
2 attempts remaining
HINT: <no title>
[0 points 4 / 4 points left]

Draw a diagram to represent the scenario. Let the unknown side be yy.

STEP: Draw a diagram
[2 points 2 / 4 points left]

The diagonal goes from one corner of the square to the other corner. Since this is a square, we also know that the corner angles are all equal to 9090.

We have now formed two right-angled triangles. So, we can use the theorem of Pythagoras to calculate the length of the sides.

STEP: Apply the theorem of Pythagoras
[2 points 0 / 4 points left]

Let a side of the square be yy. All of the sides of a square are the same length. So if we let one side be yy, then the other sides must also be yy.

y2+y2=(4)2(Pythagoras)2y2=162y22=162y2=8y=8y=2.8284...2.83 cmy2+y2=(4)2(Pythagoras)2y2=162y22=162y2=8y=8y=2.8284...2.83 cm

Therefore, each side of the square is 2.83 cm2.83 cm in length.

NOTE: The equation y2=8y2=8 has two solutions: 2.832.83 or 2.832.83. But, yy is always positive because it is a length. So, we ignore the negative solution.

Walking across a field

Lesedi lives on the opposite side of a rectangular field from her school. She can either walk around the outside of the field, or straight across.

Yesterday Lesedi walked around the outside of the field to get to school. She walked straight for 57 m57 m, then turned left and walked another 33 m33 m.

Today, she decides to walk straight across the field. How much shorter will her walk be today?

INSTRUCTION: Round your answer to the nearest metre (m)metre (m).
Answer:

Lesedi's walk will be mm shorter than yesterday.

one-of
type(numeric.abserror(1.0))
2 attempts remaining
HINT: <no title>
[0 points 4 / 4 points left]

The route across the field forms a right-angled triangle. Which theorem allows you to calculate sides in a right-angled triangle?

STEP: Calculate the distance across the field
[2 points 2 / 4 points left]

The field is a rectangle, and the route across the field forms a right-angled triangle.

We can use the theorem of Pythagoras to calculate the distance across the field. Let the distance be dd.

d2=572+332(Pythagoras)d2=4338d=4338d=65.86349...65.86 md2=572+332(Pythagoras)d2=4338d=4338d=65.86349...65.86 m

STEP: Calculate how much shorter the route is
[2 points 0 / 4 points left]

9065.86=24.1424 m9065.86=24.1424 m

Therefore, Lesedi's walk will be 24 m24 m shorter than yesterday.

The variable cc represents the hypotenuse in the theorem of Pythagoras. So we can substitute the other sides of the triangle in for aa and bb.

a2+b2=c2(Pythagoras)(7)2+(5)2=c2a2+b2=c2(Pythagoras)(7)2+(5)2=c2
